powerwalk.model

Class Destinations

  • java.lang.Object
    • powerwalk.model.Destinations

  • public class Destinations
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that maps destination Strings to their respective Tiles in the World.

    • Constructor Summary

      Destinations()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Destinations

        public Destinations()

    • Method Detail

      • setupDestinationList

        public static void setupDestinationList()
        (re)collects the destination information and stores it for lookup. There is no need to call this method before looking up destinations, the getDestination() method automatically loads the destinationList when it hasn't been loaded yet.

      • purge

        public static void purge()
        Purges the destinationList, freeing the memory used. Please be aware that the next call to getDestination will rebuild the destination List.

        Note that purging the destinationList will erase any custom destinations set with the setCustomDestination(name,destination) method.

      • getDestination

        public static org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Tile getDestination(java.lang.String dest)
        get the Tile corresponding to a location.
        Parameters:
        dest - the destination to look up.
        Returns:
        the Tile corresponding to the String, or null if no match was found

      • getAvailableDestinations

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAvailableDestinations()
        Returns a Set containing the available destinations
        Returns:
        a Set containing the available destinations.

      • getEntries

        public static java.util.Set<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,org.powerbot.game.api.wrappers.Tile>> getEntries()

      • findNameForDestination

        public static java.lang.String findNameForDestination(Point p)
        checks if a name is registered for the given point.
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to look up
        Returns:
        the name for the given Point, or null if none exists

      • setCustomDestination

        public static void setCustomDestination(java.lang.String name,
                        Point destination)
        Assigns a custom binding for a specified String.

        consecutive calls to getDestination(name) will return the position specified by Destination.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Destination
        destination - the location of the Destination
